perturbation.original_text:
Upon the death of the Employee while this Agreement is in force, the Employee's beneficiary as named in the Beneficiary Designation Form on page
6 (or as it may be amended according to the terms set forth on page 6) for this Agreement will be entitled to receive from the Policy proceeds an
amount equal to the lesser of: (a) (two (2) times the Employee's annualized base salary at the time of death as provided by the Employer's payroll
department) plus $100,000, reduced by any amount payable under the Employer's group term life insurance plan, or (b) the Net Amount At Risk.
The Employer shall be the beneficiary of the remaining death proceeds of the policy after the Employee's interest is determined. Within 60 days after
the death of the Employee, the Employer will provide to the "Insurer" a written statement indicating the amount of each policy's proceeds the
Employee's beneficiary is entitled to receive.
perturbation.changed_text:
Upon the death of the Employee while this Agreement is in force, the Employee's beneficiary as named in the Beneficiary Designation Form on page
6 (or as it may be amended according to the terms set forth on page 6) for this Agreement will be entitled to receive from the Policy proceeds an
amount equal to the lesser of: (a) (two (2) times the Employee's annualized base salary at the time of death as provided by the Employer's payroll
department) plus $100,000, reduced by any amount payable under the Employer's group term life insurance plan, or (b) the Net Amount At Risk.
The Employer shall be the beneficiary of the remaining death proceeds of the policy after the Employee's interest is determined. Within 30 days after
the death of the Employee, the Employer will provide to the "Insurer" a written statement indicating the amount of each policy's proceeds the
Employee's beneficiary is entitled to receive.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction by stating two different deadlines (60 days and 30 days) for the Employer to provide a written statement to the Insurer regarding the proceeds distribution. This creates uncertainty and potential disputes over which deadline is enforceable.

perturbation.original_text:
This Agreement may be altered, amended or modified, including the addition of any extra policy provisions, by a written instrument signed by the
Employer and the Employee. Either party may, subject to the limitations of Article IV, assign its interest and obligations under this Agreement,
provided, however, that any assignment will be subject to the terms of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
This Agreement may be altered, amended or modified, including the addition of any extra policy provisions, by a written instrument signed by the
Employer. The Employee's consent is not required for amendments regarding policy provisions. Either party may, subject to the limitations of Article IV, assign its interest and obligations under this Agreement,
provided, however, that any assignment will be subject to the terms of this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The modified text creates a contradiction. Initially, both the Employer and Employee must sign for amendments. Later, it states that the Employee's consent is not needed for amending policy provisions. This raises ambiguity and potential disputes on the amendment procedure.

perturbation.original_text:
The Employer will keep possession of the Policies. The Employer agrees from time to time to make the policies available to the Employee or to the
"Insurer" for the purpose of endorsing or filing any change of beneficiary on the Policies but the Policies will promptly be returned to the Employer.
perturbation.changed_text:
The Employer will keep possession of the Policies. The Employer is not required to make the policies available to the Employee or to the
"Insurer" unless compelled by a court order. Policies will promptly be returned to the Employer after court proceeding.
perturbation.explanation: Originally, the Employer must make policies available for beneficiary changes. The modification states the Employer is not required to do so unless mandated by a court order. This directly contradicts the initial clause, introducing ambiguity about policy access for beneficiary changes.
